abstract: Indian police and forestry officials fatally shoot 20 loggers suspected of illegally cutting down endangered red sandalwood trees; killings draw accusations of excessive force; wood from trees can be sold in China and Japan for hundreds of thousands of dollars a ton.
lead_paragraph: Officials said the loggers had been felling endangered red sandalwood trees, whose wood can be sold in China and Japan for hundreds of thousands of dollars a ton.

headline.main: Indian Police Shoot and Kill 20 Said to Be Illegally Cutting Down Trees
headline.print_headline: 20 Indian Loggers Die in Clash Over Rare Trees

snippet: Officials said the loggers had been felling endangered red sandalwood trees, whose wood can be sold in China and Japan for hundreds of thousands of dollars a ton.
